data.title: Light+ Theme - added color is barely diffrentiable
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

0. Have "Light+ (default light)" theme selected
1. To a existing file, add a word on a line
2. Then do git view
3. You will see the "added" shade is barely visible from the green behind it, here is a screenshot, I added the word `, clearCover`:

![](http://i.imgur.com/n18BUjA.png)


Please make the light green and dark green more diffrentiated so it catches our eye while scrolling by. In the screenshot I used the green in the arrow, we can see we can't differentiate it.

data.title: vscode source
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: macOS 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1../code.sh
2.Loading "gc-signals" failed
Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 50, got 51.
    at Error (native)
    at process.module.(anonymous function) [as dlopen] (ELECTRON_ASAR.js:178:20)
    at Object.Module._extensions..node (module.js:583:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as .node] (ELECTRON_ASAR.js:178:20)
    at Module.load (module.js:473:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:432:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:424:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:483:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Volumes/document/microsoft/vscode/node_modules/gc-signals/src/index.js:8:18)
Here are the modules that depend on it:
Detail: 
Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 50, got 51.
Array[1] ["vs/workbench/api/node/mainThreadHeapService"]

data.title: [Suggestion] Installer start menu shortcut

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
![explorer_2017-03-05_03-32-16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/75278/23583994/5f0ab3b8-0154-11e7-9386-71b7e2592fcc.png)
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Visual Studio Code
2. Open the Start Menu

Instead of creating the shortcut to Visual Studio Code directly, the installer creates a folder "Visual Studio Code" that then has the .lnk to Visual Studio Code. Suggestion is to create the shortcut directly, without using a folder that only has one item.

data.title: Updating to version 1.10.1 stopped eslint from enforcing any rules
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: MacOSSierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create .eslintrc.json with rules and place in root folder or just add this to workspace settings:

"eslint.enable": true,
"eslint.options": {
    "rules": {
        "semi": [2, "never"],
        "jsx/jsx-quotes": [2, "prefer-double"],
        "quotes": ["error", "single"]
    }
} 

2.Notice the rules are not enforced

I have been using eslint fine with the previous version of vs code but since I upgraded, the rules are no longer enforced, there are no errors.

data.title: File corrupted while saving after close all
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. With multiple files open in the editor, some of which have been modified but not been saved.
2. Click 'Close All' (Ctrl K W). Click Save when prompted.
Sometimes files get corrupted, i.e., a file could be overwritten or partially overwritten by the content from another file.

data.title: Open window on first monitor upon first launch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Fresh Installation on a computer with two screens
2. First launch of the application

On the first launch, the main window was centered on my secondary screen, not on my primary screen. It may sounds dumb, but my secondary screen is often turned off, so I didn't see the window on the first launch until I realised it may be on the secondary screen.

Besides, I'm not sure, but is it recommended to choose a screen and a position on the screen in Windows OS? I though it is better to let the OS to set the position of the window.

data.title: c_cpp_properties.json not giving correct c++ library path under windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a `.cpp` file, write a `#include` statement, for example, `#include <iostream>`
2. hover the mouse on the yellow lightbulb and generate `c_cpp_properties.json`
3. the `includePath` property is not correct in my case. VSCode gives `C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0/VC/include/*` which in my case, the c++ library is under `C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft Visual Studio\\2017\\Community\\VC\\Tools\\MSVC\\14.10.24930\\include\\*`

Perhaps need to detect which version of visual studio one has?

data.title: Option to use macOS standard titlebar
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1 (1.10.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the latest version of VSCode (v1.10.0 or higher)
2. Examine the window titlebar, and note that its appearance and functionality are a custom implementation rather than the macOS standard titlebar

I would appreciate a setting to use the macOS standard titlebar for a few reasons:
1. The [titlebar proxy icon](http://hints.macworld.com/article.php?story=2010031117415674) is a powerful macOS standard feature that VSCode's custom titlebar doesn't support
2. The macOS standard titlebar right-click offers a better interface (with icons) than the duplicate functionality implemented by VSCode's custom titlebar
3. Some applications such as [HyperDock](https://bahoom.com/hyperdock/) add system-wide functionality to window titlebars (in this case, scrolling on them to maximize the window), which doesn't work with VSCode's custom titlebar

Thanks for your consideration!

data.title: expose an ability (for extensions) to color some code pieces
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.10.1
- OS Version:Win10/x64

feature request.

I'm using the editor for C++ development, so the case when some code pieces are inactive due the language features (simple example is preprocessor definitions). I've [asked](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/510) your collegues who works on cpp-tools about this feature (highlight some code as inactive/greyed, like IDEs usually do this) 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3259933/23139466/91108c02-f7bd-11e6-8282-166b2a3cbf70.png)
but they told me that vscode doesn't expose this ability. any chance to implement this? 
I suppose this also can be used e.g. for code coverage

Thank you

data.title: VS Code Insider: ver 1.11.0 issues with extensions can't be uninstalled.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider 
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 16.04.1
- Extensions: 
|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.9|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.12|
|csharpextensions|jchannon|1.3.0|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.3.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|
|python-extended-snippets|tushortz|0.0.1|;

---

In reference to an issue posted "MSSQL: SQL Tools Service not starting on latest VS Code Insider #718", I discover a possible bug with all extension not able to be uninstalled.

Posted on MSSQL issue:

I had mssql extension (version 0.3.0) working on VS Code Insider 1.10.0 on my Linux machine working fine. But, I proceeded to update to VS Code to version 1.11.0 and now I'm getting an error: "Unable to execute the command while the extension is initializing".

And, it's worse! I can't uninstalled any of my existing extensions. Clicking on the "uninstall" won't do anything. I can only to disable/enable but it won't clear the issue.

The SqlToolsService is hung up trying to initialize the service. No debug error message is generated.
I'm on Linux Ubuntu 16.04.1, VS Code 1.11.0.

Now, the Windows version VS Code ver. 1.11.0 and the extensions "uninstall" works fine.

data.title: Proof of Concept: User color theme overrides
data.body:
This is a proof of concept implementation of user color theme overrides.

It exposes a configuration setting that would allow user overrides for all themes, or only for light or dark themes as seen in the gifs below.

This is  PR that would satisfy my use case as described in [this comment](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11556#issuecomment-283976552) while having minimal impact on the performance and complexity of the theme service, but I understand that it might not fit with the vision of the team. If that is the case, I am happy to hear feedback and see what type of contribution would be accepted.

![vscodethemeoverrides1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2957173/23581026/14c245ec-010d-11e7-904b-f93fdf258682.gif)
![vscodethemeoverrides2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2957173/23581030/1f0acd26-010d-11e7-8302-9f6cbb8e682c.gif)

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)

data.title: Debugger: do not attach, error, grey breakpoints
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Sometimes debugger do not attach to a process run with `node --inspect` command until I make http request to my app. Breakpoints are grey and there is an error in debug console:

```
Error processing "setBreakpoints": Error: Set breakpoints request timed out
    at Timeout.setTimeout (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/ms-vscode.node-debug2/node_modules/vscode-chrome-debug-core/out/src/utils.js:55:24)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:232:11)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:202:5)
```
Also after I save file debugger sometimes do not reattach to process.

```json
    {
      "name": "Attach",
      "type": "node",
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "request": "attach",
      "restart": true,
      "skipFiles": [
        "node_modules/**/*.js",
        "<node_internals>/**/*.js"
      ],
      "smartStep": true,
      "port": 9229
    }
```

Looks like this:
![ozmsjpggyz](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6762673/23578438/20d9a854-00e8-11e7-9d99-c9316072413f.gif)

I also have this error:
![screen shot 2017-03-04 at 21 14 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6762673/23581141/cb052628-011f-11e7-97d8-c3b12a098dd0.png)

data.title: "typescript service had died repeatedly more than 5 times in the last 5 minutes" warning after tsserver Code Helper bugs & is force quit
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:27:09.350Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vimStyle|74th|0.4.7|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.6.2|
|vscode-file-peek|abierbaum|1.0.1|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|vscode-dash|deerawan|1.3.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|RelativePath|jakob101|0.12.0|
|docthis|joelday|0.4.3|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.0.3|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|lit-it|mohseenrm|1.2.10|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|
|latex|ms-vscode|0.1.3|
|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|2.0.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.5|
|node-modules-resolve|naumovs|1.0.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.3.0|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.23.0|
|addDocComments|stevencl|0.0.8|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.6|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|html2jade|wmaurer|0.2.0|
|join-lines|wmaurer|0.2.2|
|vscode-jumpy|wmaurer|0.3.1|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;


---
Scenario:

I'm not sure how to reproduce this; if I manage to do it again, I'll update the issue. 
I was seeing high (~97-100%) CPU usage from this `Code Helper.app` process running `tsserver.js`:
```
/Users/jskrzypek/Downloads/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Users/jskrzypek/Downloads/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/utils/electronForkStart /usr/local/lib/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js --useSingleInferredProject --enableTelemetry
```
I noticed that both this process and another Code Helper running `typescript`
```
/Users/jskrzypek/Downloads/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Users/jskrzypek/.nvm/versions/node/v6.9.5/lib/node_modules/typescript/lib/typingsInstaller.js --globalTypingsCacheLocation /Users/jskrzypek/Library/Caches/typescript --enableTelemetry
```
stuck around after quitting vscode. I googled for an issue and found #20260 which had an instruction to try using the `TSS_LOG` shell parameter to enable tsserver logging. I "force quit" the misbehaving `tsserver.js` activity from the Activity Monitor and then followed the instructions in the comment https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20260#issuecomment-282408109 and ran this:
```
export TSS_LOG="-level verbose -file ~/tss.log"
code .
```
After vscode opened, I got a warning at the top of the window informing me that the typescript service had died repeatedly more than 5 times in the last 5 minutes. This warning modal kept appearing repeatedly, leading me to believe that whatever was triggering the warning kept occurring. I clicked on the button to create the issue and then quit vscode. When I looked, the `tts.log` file did not  exist. After running `code .` a second time the warning did not appear.

Other notes:

It noticed that I also have a Sublime Text node process running `tsserver.js` hanging around long after I've quit ST that is also showing high cpu use. I was running bot ST and vscode simultaneously at some point recently, I think on the same project/folder.

data.title: Output window does not respect codepage
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1 (653f8733)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro (10.0.14393)
- User settings
```
{
    "files.encoding": "cp852",
    "editor.minimap.enabled": true,
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\System32\\cmd.exe"
}
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have file `errors.log` written in `CP 852`
```
Dočasná tabulka (TEMP TABLE) ttSumaStavu nebyla nalezena. (5445)
** .\a_s\r_prefak.p Nemohu porozumět řádku 23. (196)
```
2. Configure task
```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cmd",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "args": ["/C"],

    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "Check codepage",
            "suppressTaskName": true,
            "isBuildCommand": false,
            "args": ["chcp && type errors.log"]
        }
    ]
}
```
3. Run the task
![obrazek](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4008662/23577857/3a2118b0-00ca-11e7-9378-2bfcf74f4992.png)
4. Run the command `chcp && type errors.log` manually in terminal window
![obrazek](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4008662/23577882/755f4b22-00ca-11e7-8b89-ca51623e7c7e.png)

data.title: Multi line editing only removes first occurrence when pressed backspace
data.body:
When selected multiple occurrences with `ctrl + d` and tried to remove them with backspace will remove only first occurrence. While delete key will do the trick. In Sublime Text, backspace removes all occurrence.

This is what pressing backspace does
![withbackspace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2367137/23577564/d58958b0-00ea-11e7-99e1-9315dc7a2280.gif)

This is what pressing delete key does
![withdelete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2367137/23577565/dcf1b9bc-00ea-11e7-8dad-8fe6cea58353.gif)

VSCode Version is 1.10.1
